data.title: Lotus F1 link with Four Seasons in Singapore
data.meta_description: Formula One team to sport hotel group’s logo for Singapore Grand Prix.
data.text:
Formula One team Lotus F1 have sealed a sponsorship deal with the Four Seasons Hotel and HPL Hotels & Resorts.

The deal will see the team sport the Four Seasons logo alongside the SG50 logo – in celebration of Singapore’s Golden Jubilee – on the livery of its F1 cars, driven by Romain Grosjean and Pastor Maldonado, for the 2015 Formula 1 Singapore Airlines Singapore Grand Prix.

The Four Seasons Hotel in Singapore is operated by Singapore-based hospitality management company HPL Hotels & Resorts.

Stephen Lau, the chairman of HPL Hotels and Resorts, said: “This 2015 Formula 1 Singapore Airlines Singapore Grand Prix provides a fantastic platform to showcase the nation's momentous milestone to a global television audience of more than 85 million, watching the home of Formula One night racing.”

Pharrell Williams ‘happy’ with Lotus deal

Mike Crawford, the Asia Pacific president of Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts, said: “Four Seasons is thrilled to be associated with this world-class event.

“Together with our properties in Singapore, Jimbaran Bay and Sayan in Bali, and Kuda Huraa and Landaa Giraavaru in the Maldives, we have joined in the celebration of Singapore's 50th birthday.”

The race will take place at the Marina Bay Street Circuit over the weekend from 18th to 20th September.
